action.action-desc: Mr. McKinley (for himself and Ms. Titus) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to provide additional educational assistance under the Post-9/11 Educational Assistance Program of the Department of Veterans Affairs to certain eligible individuals.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the GI Bill STEM Extension Act of 2015.

section.header: Additional educational assistance under Post-9/11 Educational Assistance Program of Department of Veterans Affairs

subsection.text: Subchapter II of chapter 33 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:
The Secretary may provide to an eligible individual additional educational assistance under this section.

The Secretary shall pay to each individual who receives educational assistance under this section who is pursuing a program of education the amount payable under section 3313 of this title for such program of education for a period of not more than nine months.
An eligible individual is an individual—

paragraph.text: who is or was entitled to educational assistance under section 3311 of this title;
who has used all of the educational assistance to which the individual is entitled under this chapter; and

subparagraph.text: is enrolled in a program of education leading to a post-secondary degree that requires more than the standard 128 semester (or 192 quarter) credit hours for completion in—

clause.text: computer and information science and support services;
engineering technologies or an engineering-related field;
a health profession or related program; or

subparagraph.text: has earned a post-secondary degree in a field referred to in subparagraph (A) and is enrolled in a program of education leading to a teaching certification.
